alert.note: Alert for Coosa (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 17 at 6:38PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Tallapoosa and northeastern Coosa Counties through 715 PM CDT... At 637 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Goodwater, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Alexander City, Dadeville, Goodwater, Camp Hill, Kellyton, Jacksons` Gap, New Site, Goldville, Hillabee Creek, Bradford, Northern Lake Martin, Hatchet, Daviston, Horseshoe Bend National Military Park, Hackneyville, Eagle Creek and Horseshoe Bend. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
